items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative at SalesRoads

Remote | Part-time

SalesRoads, one of Inc 5000’s fastest growing companies and Best Workplaces for Flexibility in 2016, is looking for talented individuals to work as Inside Sales Reps from their home office.

This position is an employment opportunity where you can schedule flexible hours and work out of your home office. Our sales reps cold call into business executives from a list provided and schedule qualified appointments for professional services companies. Payroll is bi-weekly and is comprised of a competitive hourly pay plus a bonus for each appointment set.

Employees of SalesRoads enjoy the following benefits:

  • Competitive hourly rate, bonuses, and incentives
  • A growth-oriented environment that wants your ideas on how to succeed and improve. We promote from within.
  • Payments are bi-weekly including bonuses
  • Paid training
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Skip the drive by telecommuting from your home office
  • Employee Benefits including dental, vision, 401k

Requirements:

A reliable computer, a high speed Internet connection, and a headset are required. Must have previous cold calling and sales experience.

Apply for job

Dynamic startup FranchiseBlast builds the world's most user friendly franchise management system. An exceptional team and a great work environment make FranchiseBlast an awesome company to work for.

Job Description

We are looking for someone who can make a significant impact at FranchiseBlast in an inside sales / business development role. We are demanding, but we are rewarding. We are at an inflection point in our company’s history and we would like to see the selected candidate advance in their role to become one of the core pillars of the company.

We offer a flexible work environment. Here are the required skills:
• Good listening skills and empathy
• Excellent understanding of the various business operations (legal, sales, accounting) to see things from the franchisor’s perspective.
• Very comfortable with technology – ability to adapt to the technological level of the interlocutor and provide simple explanations
• Be very confident without falling into arrogance
• Possess previous experience in selling software solutions (in a startup environment)
• Detail-oriented; be able to mention what the two founders of the company studied in university in their motivation letter
• Ability to self-motivate, plan and manage time, develop your own working structures and seek to improve procedures on an ongoing basis
• Ambitious and demanding, determined to succeed and willing to move forward in a changing environment
• Creative : Able to recognize a need and find the best way to fill it
• Excellent written and spoken English, ideally bilingual (French)
• Having the audacity and flair for identifying opportunities, but also patience and resilience.

Assets
• Experience in business and / or within a franchise
• Self motivated and independent
• University degree, new graduates welcome

Your Mission
• Lead generation, demos and follow-ups
• Develop strategies and apply best practices in sales
• Work with the development team to identify requested features or ways to simplify the product
• Timely report all technical difficulties with the site or customers
• Wear different hats! (Marketing, for example)

Compensation
$35K–$100K
No Equity

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Remote
Anywhere in
Europe

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Giant Swarm GmbH; 10-50 employees; 75-100% remote;

We are looking for a Sales Development Representative

Your Job

- As our first SDR you lead the initial outreach to targeted enterprise customer accounts across Europe. You drive the pipeline among our highest potential customers and bookings.
- Turning Marketing Qualified Leads (MQL) into Sales Qualified Leads (SQL) is one of your major tasks. You are happy to drive and be fully responsible for outbound initiatives.
- You organize the lead-handover to our Account Executives and C-Level and coordinate first meeting with the customer.
- You are responsible for our target list. You are happy to use tools like Hubspot or Linkedin Sales Navigator. If you want other SDR Tools, just implement them.


Requirements

- You have experience as a Sales Development Representative in a technical company.
- You can explain to us why Microservices and Kubernetes are ‘changing the game”.
- ‘Getting things done’ is an important part of your job. Following and creating good and structured workflows to manage our growth is as important.
- You’re fluent in German and English.
- We (and our customers) are currently mostly distributed around Europe (around UTC), thus, your main timezone should be somewhere between -2UTC to +2UTC to ensure better communication.


Why we think this position is worth applying (challenge us!)

- Impact, Impact, Impact! We are a remote-first organization with 25 people with 13 nationalities (located in 9 countries). Every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcomed.
We are currently building our Sales Team from Scratch and you, as our first SDR will have a huge impact on this field!
- “It's better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) - sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things like in the guidebook. You can try things out!
- We play a key-role in our customers digital transformation. We have partnered up with Amazon and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow.
- We serve some of Europe's leading organizations and are talking to many more.

WHY US?

We like to give you a glimpse on how working with is like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

Teamwork

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.

We are not hiring job descriptions. We hire humans. :) We welcome applications from everybody, regardless ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.

Interested? Questions? Contact Anna.

items.title: Online Fundraising Manager
items.content:
Online Fundraising Manager

Various
Various US States
Company: 350.org
Full Time

Overview

 

Title:Online Fundraising Manager

 

Reporting to:Development Director

 

Location:CA, CT, CO, DC, GA, MA, ME, MD, MT, NC, NJ, NY PA, VA, VT, WA, and WI

Start Date: October 1, 2018

Primary Purpose:

In partnership with the Development team and the Digital team, the Online Fundraising Manager will create an online fundraising strategy, implement new tools and analysis, and craft effective online appeals to raise money from individuals. The ideal candidate will have the expertise and ability to translate program strategy into compelling and concise asks in emails, on websites, and on social media.

Responsibilities:

Strategy and Tools:

  • Develop a comprehensive strategy to raise more money from our online fundraising program
    • Provide analysis of our current program, where to improve, and what’s needed to implement these changes
    • Analyze where the greatest potential for growth is and assist in creating a plan to close those gaps
    • Assist with language that would be best for these segments
    • Provide new tools, tips, or ideas to raising more funding
    • Provide technical expertise with ActionKit
    • Provide technical expertise with Facebook ads and Google adwords
    • Suggest new online fundraising tools by analyzing ROI
    • Advise on best practices:
      • Suggested amounts
      • Style of asks
      • When to use images
      • Stories that are more compelling
      • Draft fundraising plans for specific campaign drives
      • Support the Development Director in assessing funding opportunities in support of anticipated programming and operational needs.

        • Crafting the ask:

        • Take the lead in drafting compelling fundraising content from action alerts or other communications in collaboration with program staff
        • Draft content, and lead the editing and approval process
        • Target and build segments for each appeal, with appropriate editing made for different segments
        • Convene and lead online fundraising meetings
        • Liaise with digital and campaign leads on a recurring basis for updates about upcoming work and integrating fundraising asks
        • Create donation pages in multiple languages and currencies
        • Create social media ads and coordinate with the digital team for posting
        • Create new donation pages and improve current ones
        • Work with the Development team on all aspects of online fundraising and email appeals

          • Analytics:

          • Run reports on email performance and metrics; look for ways to improve data gathering and analysis, and make recommendations on changes based on results
          • Run reports on donor segments, offer ways to retain and renew donors, convert to sustaining monthly donors or increase individual donations.
          • Analyze email appeal performance and report individual and overall results to Development team

            • Public Engagement

            • Understand 350.org’s history, campaigns, and theory of change, and keep current with basic climate science and policy. Occasionally use this knowledge to represent 350.org’s perspective in public venues based on geographic location and areas of expertise.
            • Contribute work towards 350.org’s overall mission that is outside of standard responsibilities and instead relies solely on geographic location or work capacity.

              • Qualifications
              • Bachelor’s degree or combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
              • 4 years of online fundraising experience required, preferably for an environmental organization.
              • Documented success as an online fundraiser.
              • Must be a strong writer with proven ability to develop high-level, compelling copy. Ability to quickly synthesize complex ideas and turn them into concise appeals.
              • High level of experience with A/B testing, running fundraising cycles for large email lists, and making projections based on available data
              • Detail-oriented with strong project management skills in planning, prioritizing, and coordinating multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
              • Excellent technical, analytical, and communications skills.
              • High level of confidence and ability to work independently as well as within a team structure; proven ability to work well with diverse groups of people in different departments and functions.
              • Technology Skills: Google suite, Microsoft suite,Google Analytics, ActionKit, database management (CivCRM and SQL a plus), Google Adwords.
              • Strong interpersonal skills, including verbal and written communications skills, as well as a professional telephone manner

                • The Ideal Candidate Will Be:
                • Excited about online fundraising, new tools and data systems
                • Comfortable working alone within a remote team
                • A diplomatic communicator who is comfortable working with diverse constituencies while maintaining a high-level of discretion and confidentiality
                • A strong project manager with excellent organizational skills and the ability to work in a self-directed fashion
                • Comfortable taking initiative, working alone while being a contributing team member
                • Able to maintain the integrity of donor data
                • Engage in initiatives that foster team collaboration, including meetings, trainings, retreats, and special projects

                  • To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/350org/jobs/1290630 →

items.content:
Account Director

Company: Explainify
Headquarters: Fayetteville, AR
https://explainify.breezy.hr/p/5aa231dc81e0-account-director-remote?source=weworkremotely

Sure - you could keep selling networking solutions, web design, or boring content services like you’ve been doing for years...and years...

Or you could sell something everyone wants to talk to you about.

We’re looking for that special someone to forge the sales path for our “small giant” video company where we choose to be great instead of big.

We’re a team that passionately and deeply cares...about our people, our service and our clients. We call it 'boutique by design'.

In this role, you’ll get to satisfy your entrepreneurial itch by building our account strategy from scratch. Prospect and navigate “one and done” and existing accounts, turning them into long term customers and growing serious revenue. You’ll write the playbook and execute it on your own.

There’s less travel (20% or less) required than you’ve ever had in a sales role.

And we’re open to remote / work from home.

Bonus if you have b2b marketing or content agency experience (selling of ideas)

About Us:

At Explainify, we make short animated videos to help businesses clearly explain what they do and why it matters. We’re storytellers that drive an audience to take action by working with forward-thinking marketing leaders of high-growth, innovative companies.

You know all those crappy corporate videos that make you cringe?

Well - we don’t make those. Ours are power-packed with explanation and buyer psychology that drives real action. Not to mention, they look pretty fantastic.

About the Job:

  • You’ll write the playbook and focus on revenue growth of an additional $1mm in revenue in 12 months.
  • Map people within an organization and get introductions throughout.
  • Take warm relationships to a new level. Take old relationships and reinvigorate them so Explainify is top of mind.

About You:

  • 5+ years of impressive, B2B sales experience
  • Experience navigating large corporate accounts
  • High level of client empathy. Build confidence and rapport quickly
  • Thrive in problem-solving and listening to customer needs to find a solution
  • Asks intriguing questions. Easily draws people in and understands them well. Not always closing
  • Do the job that needs to be done, even if it falls outside your own comfort zone
  • Comfortable with a blank canvas because there’s no step by step guide
  • A driven, self motivated learner that doesn’t need hand-holding
  • Persistent despite hearing “no” more than “yes.” Even on the hard days
  • Ambitious and willing to own this role, but still coachable. Not set in your ways

What you gain:

Well here's the good stuff:

  • Six-figure pay with uncapped commission
  • 3 weeks paid vacation plus paid holidays
  • Flexible schedule

Then there's the great stuff:
  • Getting to blaze an entirely new path for a great, young company that people love
  • Working with people who know who you are and care about you as a person
  • Your ideas matter. We don’t care where the best idea came from as long as we put the best solution in place.
  • Open leadership style - talk to our founder directly at any time and let him know what you think.
  • You’ll be working in the two greatest markets in the world... Video & Technology

What you lose:

  • The corporate politics of your current and past sales jobs
  • The cutthroat, backstabbing and being thrown under the bus
  • Traditional benefits, but commission makes up for that
  • Being anonymous in a giant organization. Being lost in the crowd sucks
  • Having to wear a suit all day. We’re pretty casual and creative

This full-time position will work from the Explainify office in Fayetteville, Arkansas (voted top small city to live in; Google it).

If this sounds like you, apply now. Don't forget your video explaining why you were born to do this role.

Apply for this position

https://explainify.breezy.hr/p/5aa231dc81e0-account-director-remote?source=weworkremotely

Enterprise Account Executive, New York at MemSQL

New York City, Remote · Full Time
MemSQL is a Y-Combinator, SF-based startup that is leading the next wave of big data. MemSQL's real-time database is the fastest performing and most scalable database for transactions & analytics. Those early to take advantage include customers: Comcast, Boeing, Samsung, Zynga, etc.; Investors: NEA, Accel Partners, Khosla Ventures, In-Q-Tel; capitalizing MemSQL with almost $100M across just three tranches of investment and we’ve hardly scratched the surface.Read More

MemSQL is a Y-Combinator, SF-based startup that is leading the next wave of big data. MemSQL's real-time database is the fastest performing and most scalable database for transactions & analytics. Those early to take advantage include customers: Comcast, Boeing, Samsung, Zynga, etc.; Investors: NEA, Accel Partners, Khosla Ventures, In-Q-Tel; capitalizing MemSQL with almost $100M across just three tranches of investment and we’ve hardly scratched the surface.

MemSQL allows applications to run in-memory, scales horizontally on commodity hardware, and able to be deployed anywhere; both on-premise and in the cloud. MemSQL is built on a distributed system with a lock-free data structure able to ingest limitless amounts of data with zero downtime. Features include geospatial functionality, connectors & integrations allowing companies to combine semi-structured data all in one place.

MemSQL has an incredibly high-caliber team at one of the most exciting high-growth companies in tech. If you have the track record to be part of this elite team, we want to talk to you.

Applied
Apply to MemSQL
Add a message to MemSQL
Apply

Job Description

Position Overview
MemSQL is looking for an accomplished sales professional to join our Enterprise Sales Team. In this role you will be responsible for closing new business and expanding existing business with large enterprise customers in the tri-state region. This is an incredible opportunity to join an established, fast-growing startup in the enterprise software industry, where you will have the opportunity to over-achieve, earning uncapped commission and accelerators.

Enterprise Account Executives at MemSQL are accomplished sales leaders who are passionate about evangelizing the industry’s most disruptive technologies. You’re excited to exercise your modern data infrastructure expertise and communicate solution value to enterprise accounts. You also possess an in-depth understanding of the market landscape, have the ability to partner closely with sales engineers and inside sales reps, and can thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Role and Responsibilities
Develop and execute territory account plans to achieve (ideally exceed) quota
Lead multiple customer sales cycles and effectively close new business (hunter mentality with the ability to sign new logos)
Manage and grow large, strategic enterprise accounts
Effectively partner with Sales Engineering, Inside Sales, and Field Marketing
Quickly learn our software products and be able to clearly communicate the value proposition
Develop strong relationships with key decision makers, influencers, and partners within your territory
Travel within your assigned territory

Required Skills and Experience
Proven track record of successfully selling enterprise software solutions and increasing revenue through new customer acquisition
Solution selling of a disruptive technology in the data infrastructure space
Firm understanding of the modern data infrastructure such as the open source community and the various enterprise software (business intelligence, analytics, ETL, cloud infrastructure, etc.) products
Demonstrated ability to sell to CXO or line of business, successfully emphasizing business value versus product
Strong ability to connect with customers to understand their individual business needs
B.S. degree or equivalent in a related field
Understanding of OLTP and OLAP architectures is a plus

Skills
Sales, Databases, Enterprise Software, Enterprise Sales
Compensation
$260K–$300K

items.content:
Backend Developer (for our ROIBACK business)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: B2B, Information Technology, Travel & Tourism
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Private
Company: The Hotelbeds Group | Palma, Spain

Remote details

Office Location: Palma, Spain. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

javascript
python
sql
html5
linux

Job description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES.


How can you help us?

We are seeking for top programmers and software architects to be part of our technology team.

As a software developer:


• As part of our booking engine team, implementing user stories with high business value using good techniques and practices.
• Helping the Product Ower in clarifying, prioritizing and estimating the user stories.
• Designing technical solutions and developing clear, testesable and efficient code, performing peer reviews with your collegueas.
• Ensuring continuous integration and build is in place.
• Collaborating with architects and other developers to produce just enough design and just enough technical documentation.
• Writing technical user stories for refactoring the existing code or implementing new technical features.

As a software architect:


• Doing some up front architecture envisioning to get started the developments in the right direction, collaboratively working with the team.
• Facilitating the architectural modeling and evolution efforts of our technological platform.
• Understanding of the business domain and communicating the architecture to developers and to other project stakeholders.
• Practising code review, pair programming and other agile techniques to improve the development team programming skills.
• Transitioning architectural skills to other team members

What can we offer you?


• To participate in very challenging projects with the top hotel chains from Europe, Asia and America, from the idea to the delivery.
• To work in a Company that invests (really invests) in technology.
• To be part of an Agile culture to obtain the best results in software development and to become a high-performance team, in a really happy environment.
• Work together with extremely passionate programmers, and being part of a top programmer community.
• To be part of a team-making decisions, to determine the technical roadmap of our platforms.
• To lead both business and technical projects from end-to-end.
• To live in the best city of the World

(http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/homes_and_gardens/best_places/article1533629.ece)

CANDIDATE PROFILE.

• It is a must to hold a University degree in Engineering or Computing Sciences, or having completed at least 80%.
•  If you know Python or Go ... excellent! But what we are really looking for is a top programmer who loves technology and software development, and ready to learn any programming language that could be required.
• You have to feel comfortable working with databases (SQL and NoSQL), web programming (HTML5, CSS3, Javascript) and Linux environments.
• Good programming best-practices, such continuous integration, unit testing generation, code repositories, log management, code comments and documentation ...
• You will need to meet with the business to understand the needs and to translate them into code.
• You will be part of an agile team, so, what is really important in Roiback is the team success, not the individual success.
• It is not a must to have a lot of experience. For us, what is really important is the potential and attitude you have to become a great programmer

Apply now

About The Hotelbeds Group

Roiback.com

About us

We specialise in the development and management of online projects for hotel chains and independent hotels. We not only have a knack for all things digital, but we also have a knack for people. We know that the closer we are to you, the better and more adapted solutions we'll provide to your business. We have over 15 years experience in the industry, which has allowed us to develop a team of professionals who exceed in their fields. WHAT WE DO: We work with our partners to get to the nitty gritty of their business. This allows us to design custom-made solutions that deliver tangible results and provide a real answer to market demand. Our passion allows us to never stop improving our service and product offering, day in, day out. • Integrated Marketing Online Management. We help you build your brand differentiation in today’s crowded digital space. We have a flair for everything online and a real passion for the hospitality industry. Our method is quite simple: we first analyse your needs and then define action plans that make sense for you. We bring you a fresh approach to help you get the most out of your marketing spend, finding cost-effective ways to drive more traffic, and more bookings, to your website. • Web Design & Development. Our websites are specifically created for with the hotelier in mind. Designed to work on any device, strikingly beautiful and with a slick user experience. We are passionate about building websites that will engage visitors and drive conversions, taking direct channel sales to a new level. • Booking Engine for Hotels // BACKHOTEL 4.5 We specialise in creating technology that works for hoteliers. Our booking engine brings together beautiful design and seamless user experience to capture and convert your web traffic into bookings for your direct channel. • Technology We have direct integrations with the industry’s main Channel Managers and Property Management Systems to simplify the way you manage your direct channel.

Website

http://www.roiback.com

Headquarters

Palma de Mallorca, Islas Baleares

Year founded

2010

Company type

Privately Held

Company size

51-200 employees

Specialties

booking engine, web development, digital marketing, travel, tourism, web design, technology, and hotels

Benefits

  • Pretty sure
  • You prefer
  • To join our team
  • And enjoy all
  • We can offer
  • Than read it here

items.content:
Accounting Administrative Assistant at Achieve Test Prep

Remote | Part-time

PART-TIME | ACHIEVE | UNITED STATES

Job Information

Location: Remote

City: Virtual

Job Description

Accounting Administrative Assistant

Why Achieve?

We believe our employees empower our company and are the reason behind our success. We are the nation’s largest educational consultant and test prep center specializing in credit-by-examination degree paths, headquartered in Wayne, New Jersey.

Most working adults find it challenging to overcome the many obstacles associated with obtaining their college degree. Achieve acts as a counselor, advocate, and partner helping students achieve their degree in less time, with less effort, and for less money utilizing an alternative path to earning college credit known as credit-by-examination. Essentially, Achieve helps students bypass all of the busywork associated with taking certain college courses the traditional way, by instead passing just one test-out exam. While our credit-by-examination programs can shorten the path to any degree at virtually any college, the field where we have the greatest impact is the nursing profession.

Employee engagement and development is one of the keys to our success at Achieve! Embracing a work-from-home model for the entire company, all employees enjoy a better work-life balance through flexible work schedules. Does Achieve sound like the place for you? Apply today!

The Location: 100% Work from Home (Virtual Online). Position is open to US applicants.

The Schedule: Part-time position (up to 29 hours per week). This is a flex schedule position. A minimum of 20 hours per week must be set schedule between the hours of 7am-1pm Eastern Time Mon-Friday. Any remaining hours can be completed on an as needed basis

Employment type: Regular W2, or possible contract (1099) for an established accounting admin business – non individual

JOB DESCRIPTION

Summary/Objective

Achieve is currently seeking a part time accounting admin to be part of an energetic and positive team of committed professionals. This role will work directly with the Finance Manager to perform a variety of accounting related tasks.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Account review and data entry
  • Verifying transaction information
  • Scheduling and preparing disbursements, obtaining payment authorizations
  • Preparing and mailing invoices
  • Identifying delinquent accounts and insufficient payments
  • Verifying accounts by reconciling payments and transactions
  • Resolving account discrepancies by investigating documentation, issuing stop payments, payments or adjustments
  • Making outbound calls to customers to deal with account issues such as past due amounts and payment arrangements
  • Answer incoming questions from customers with questions about their account
  • Receive and check customers complaints regarding payments and accounts
  • Handling sensitive customer information and updating customer accounts
  • Assist in maintaining and monitoring electronica data for customers
  • Contributing to team efforts by accomplishing related results as needed
  • Review and maintain commission payments for sales department
  • Communicate with and audit tasks performed admin staff

Desired Skills & Experience:

  • Proven Accounts Payable and Receivable experience
  • Problem solving / Analysis
  • Attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Solid time management skills
  • Ability to work well in a team setting
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Adaptability to changes on a day-to-day basis
  • Proficient computer and email skills
  • Proficiency in MS Office
  • Experience with Google Suite is a plus
  • Experience with Salesforce is a plus
  • Reliable internet connection
  • Recent Quickbooks experience required
  • Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision
  • Previous experience working from home preferred

Education:

  • Associate’s Degree in Accounting or Finance OR High School Diploma (Graduate) with equivalent experience.

You can learn more by visiting our website:www.achievetestprep.com

Apply for job

The CDC reports that 1 in 4 children under age 5 is at risk for developmental delays, and yet, over 1 million children enter school each year with an undiagnosed disability. The CDC reports that 1 in 4 children under age 5 is at risk for developmental delays, and yet, over 1 million children enter school each year with an undiagnosed disability. BabyNoggin is a population health app platform that educates parents on developmental milestones and empowers parents to do developmental screenings at home. Our product seamlessly integrates data & results into physicians' records and helps refer children in need to local resources and community health centers.

Join a team of experts with 3 prior exits to disrupt the $186 billion dollar pediatrics market in the US!

www.babynoggin.com

Applied
Apply to BabyNoggin
Add a message to BabyNoggin
Apply

Job Description

BabyNoggin is a platform that develops medical apps. We take the latest scientific screening tools, and digitize them into easy apps for parents & doctors to use.

Our mission is to help achieve universal screening for all children — screening for autism, speech, emotional, and all physical delays so we can provide children treatment as soon as possible.

This position has a possibility to evolve into a salaried role based on your success. You'll be working directly with the head of sales to spearhead a mix of digital sales activities:

-Cold-calling leads
-Following up on inbound sales
-Facilitating demos/presentations
-Attending events nationwide

We are looking for creative individuals eager to learn and get involved in a small team venture-funded startup. Again, depending on performance and commitment, this internship may turn into a full-time employment.

To apply, please send an introduction with a description of your experience in marketing and the baby space. Please note, this is a work remote position.

Job Description

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Account Executive whose native language is English to join our EU sales team (based in Paris or remotely) to focus on a large European territory. In addition to strong product-market fit, the territory benefits from extensive marketing and sales exposure over the past 18 months with significant latent demand.

The role consists of engaging prospects and customers on the topic of their Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives and to help them develop a more efficient approach, leveraging Dataiku DSS. The Account Executive is responsible for the entire sales cycle, leveraging various company resources, to reach a successful collaboration with the prospect.

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Account Executive is likely to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product Management and Engineering, and will be a key player in defining Dataiku's European strategy. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the new technologies and possibilities of Big Data and Advanced Analytics.

Staff Accountant at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:
a. Movies
b. Accounts
c. Startup culture

Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry. The online shortfilm sharing portal (shortfundly) start collecting 22,000+ short films to different shortfilm categories from new age filmmakers. This portal will also use its contacts to promote the films in the shortfilm festival circuit. Shortfundly shares plenty of new films every day. We are bootstrap company. So, you are not only part of team, you are part of the company.

Skills & Prerequisites:

Knowledge of accounting theory, principles and practices
Microsoft Office proficiency
Strong priority management skills
Ability to describe accounting systems and processes in written correspondence and in procedure manual format.
Ability to prepare statistical reports and analyze financial reports.
Ability to perform mathematical computations accurately and quickly.
Ability to identify and compute ratios and percentage

Financial Duties:

Reconciles bank and credit card accounts monthly
Codes all transactions by name and account
Manages accounts receivables and accounts payables
Maintains historical records by filing documents electronically
Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends as requested
Works with respective Controller/Account Manager in forecasting income and expenses
Complies with federal, state, and local legal requirements by maintaining compliance documentation for each client
Prepare financial reports monthly for each client for review by respective Controller/Account Manager
Works with respective sales team monthly to close books

Skills
Operations, Accounting, Business Operations, Operations Management

items.title: Sales Representative
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Part Time

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: sharingXchange; 10-50 employees; 0-25% remote;

SKILLS:
• Direct Sales

sharingXchange (sX) is a social and sharing focused startup, inspired by what the sharing economy can do for our communities and environment. We’re looking for enthusiastic individuals to join the sharingXchange team. Sales team members will help grow our Property Management Listing Service for accommodations and boat share.

About sharingXchange:
In the ever-growing property rental market, there is no easy way for property owners to manage, market and distribute their rental property listings. sharingXchange provides an exclusive solution to this issue through services provided in our Property Management Listing Service
Our high-touch service increases property bookings and takes the stress out of property management. We understand the difficulties owners face when listing a property for rent, so sharingXchange has a dedicated Partner Success Team who works hands-on with each property owner to help them achieve their goals. We create enticing profiles and distribute them across other top listing websites, all while synchronizing the calendars in one place. We also have a dedicated team to search engine optimization and earning better rankings for the properties, boosting their popularity and making them more likely to be booked. Our 24/7 response team insures that the host never has to worry about missing an inquiry or booking, managing all of this on their behalf.
Responsibilities Include:
Finding property owners, property managers, or any other form of short term rentals who will be interested in getting professional online assistance with marketing and distributing their rental property listings. This can be done by any means, including phone, email, in-person, social media and more.
Introducing the prospective hosts to sharingXchange and the services we offer.
Persuading prospective hosts to partner with sharingXchange.
Assisting prospective hosts in registering on the sharingXchange website and in listing their properties if need be.
Being a liaison between the property owner and Partner Success Team when necessary
Providing business recommendations and suggestions that will contribute to the growth and success of the company overall.

Mandatory requirements:
English language, both spoken and written
Personal computer with a high-speed internet connection
Extensive USE OF INTERNET and Rental/Sharing sites knowledge a plus
Skype Account to connect to other sales team members and clients for support/training
Company offers:

Remote Workforce
We are an entirely remote team working and collaborating from all over the world. Did you know that remote workers rank their productivity 7.7/10, as opposed to office workers who rank their productivity 6.5/10? The benefits are endless, but key takeaways are:
Work from anywhere
Flexible working hours
No daily commute time or costs
Wear what you want! Who doesn’t love that?
Lower carbon footprint
Master your independence while still being part of a team

Career Advancement
As a growing company, we take pride in working with people who want to grow and develop along with us. There is always room for advancement and potential to capitalize on new opportunities within sharingXchange.

Training and Support
Even as a remote company, we provide training and extensive support to make sure you can be as successful as possible as a team member at sharingXchange.

Work With People From All Around the World
You will be working with a talented international team. Expand your network, meet new people and experience new cultures on a daily basis.

Increased Compensation Potential
Whether you’re part of our sales team or a member of our internal operations, you have the potential to earn extra income as a member of our commission based sales network. Every employee of sharingXchange has the opportunity to earn by referring accommodations to our website and being part of the sX affiliate program.

To apply please register here: https://sharingxchange.com/amb

items.content:
Account Executive (m/f) // Perdoo

Company: Perdoo

Tags:
  • communication skills
  • customer success
  • account executive
  • management consulting

    • We are looking for a full-time Account Executive who will report directly to one of our founders. As our first Sales hire you’ll be responsible for selling Perdoo to CEOs and senior level execs at companies in the EU and US.

    About us

    We’re an ambitious team of entrepreneurs excited about building the next big thing in B2B. Perdoo helps companies turn ambition into reality with our SaaS tool which is based on OKR – a goal management framework used by top-achieving businesses like Google and LinkedIn. By focusing companies around common objectives, we help them fix the broken link between strategy and execution so that everyone can work together on a clear path towards success. Many well-known companies throughout the world already trust us and our product.

    About the position

    You’ll be the most important source of revenue growth at Perdoo. Your main responsibility is to convert incoming leads to customers. You’ll be selling Perdoo to CEOs and senior level execs at companies in the EU and US. Sales at Perdoo is entirely inbound and done from our headquarters in Berlin. Hence, there’s no need for exhaustive traveling, neither do you have to disturb anyone with cold calls or cold emails. Instead, you’ll talk to prospects who have already shown an interest in our product and services, allowing you to take a consultative approach by showing them how best we can help them realize their ambitions. As we scale, your insights will dictate how our sales team operates at 10x its current size.

    As our Account Executive you will

    • Achieve revenue goals and contribute to Perdoo’s overall sales strategy and growth objectives.
    • Qualify and prioritize incoming leads.
    • Perform sales demos that give prospects a good and thorough understanding of the Perdoo product and services.

    We’d love to hear from you if you

    • Have 1-4 years experience working in sales, customer success or management consulting.
    • Have at least a Bachelor’s degree.
    • Are fluent in English, German would be a plus.
    • Have some flexibility in terms of working hours as a considerable amount of our prospects is located in the US.
    • Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
    • Are an autonomous worker and self-starter.

    What we offer

    • A fixed salary, benefits and employee stock option plan.
    • Contribute to a real-life product used by thousands of users every day.
    • Work in a dynamic, exciting and fun startup environment where every person has a voice and can have a real impact on company success.
    • Office in Berlin-Mitte, the heart of Europe’s startup scene.
    • Regular team retreats to remote locations. Last time we took the team to a finca in Mallorca.
    • An awesome rooftop overlooking Berlin with regular after-work drinks, BBQs and our annual Rooftop Party.
    • Free food and coffee in our kitchen.

Marketing and Business Development Assistant at TrySome

Brooklyn, Remote · Internship
These are early days at TrySome. If you like getting things off the ground, this is for you.Read More

These are early days at TrySome. If you like getting things off the ground, this is for you.

We are working on a mission that can make significant change in the world, now that's serious, but we are not serious!
Come have fun and help us build something incredible together.

TrySome is an innovative online marketplace for health-conscious consumers to discover products that are good for people and better for the planet. Our goal is to connect consumers with brands by online sampling in exchange for their feedback and comments. The products can then be purchased in full size at great discounts.

We are an asset to our manufacturing clients through the accurate and authentic consumer data we create at low cost with a quick turnaround. The data and feedback we provide is valuable information manufacturers use to improve and market their goods.

We lower the financial barriers for people to buy the products that match their health and environmental values while helping manufacturers of responsibly made products thrive.

Applied
Apply to TrySome
Add a message to TrySome
Apply

Job Description

We are looking for a communicative rock star with a passion and willingness to make things happen. If you can't wait to write captivating copy, we can't wait to hear from you.

YOU:
We are looking for an intelligent creative person with excellent verbal and written communication skills to join our Marketing and Communications team.
An interest in organic, vegan and fair-trade products is definitely a plus, but don’t lie about it, it’s not more important than being real.

THE JOB:
You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of digital media and communications tasks including, but not limited to:

- Designing and implementing social media and email strategy to align with TrySome’s business goals
- Generate, edit and publish engaging social media content daily (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news)
- Conduct market research
- Send out email campaigns to our subscribers
- Monitor Google Analytics and web traffic metrics, adjusting social media and email campaigns accordingly to increase web traffic
- Communicate with TrySome subscribers and social media followers. Respond to customer service inquiries in a timely manner and monitor comments and reviews
- Initiate and implement new features to develop brand awareness, like promotions, Instagram challenge or competitions
- Initiate creative growth efforts to increase number of users and manufacturers on the platform

You should have basic understanding of SEO and set up KPIs to monitor progress. You will work directly with the Chief Marketing Officer for guidance.
This position is unpaid and requires a commitment of at least 3 full days per week, preferably full time. If you prove invaluable a full time position is a possibility. We prefer if you are in NYC and can come to the office, but working remotely is an option.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

Application deadline & start date: Next internship starting in March. Apply asap. We will on-board the first right person.

TO APPLY:

Send us an email with:
- Your resume
- A writing sample (write a draft post for 2 of our 4 different social media platforms). For each post please explain why you think the particular post is good for that particular platform.

Visa Sponsorship
Not available

TrySome an innovative online marketplace for health-conscious consumers to discover products that are good for people and better for the planet. The products can be bought at great discounts, and samples are offered for free in exchange for feedback.

Our approach creates a new connection between consumers and manufacturers that removes the consumers’ risk of making a “wrong” choice and buying a product (which is oftentimes a more expensive choice) that they are not happy with - Try before you buy.

We offer manufacturers the ability to do smart sampling campaigns, which give them accurate and authentic data at low costs in a quick turnaround. We also track when people go from trying to buying products to show conversion trends.

The TrySome community is dedicated to help ethical companies become the brands of the future.
Our goal is to influence purchasing habits towards more responsibly made products, that will benefit the environment and drive positive change for ethical production.

items.content:
Sales Development Representative

Company: Startup Grind, Inc.
Headquarters: Palo Alto, CA
https://www.startupgrind.com/
Startup Grind is growing our partnerships team, focused on developing strategic relationships with brands looking to reach our global community of startups.
We’re looking for an energetic, motivated individual with an interest in developing their sales skills and building their network. The primary focus of the SDR will be to build the sales pipeline: create and seek out new opportunities (prospects) for Startup Grind - across partnerships, and event sponsorships.

You will be compensated on the number of opportunities you generate, as well as the dollar amount of new sales that are closed because of accounts you bring in. As a team, you’ll participate in monthly goals and incentives, with bonuses offered throughout. You will be a vital part of the team and overtime, will receive many opportunities for growth as your skills develop. As part of a lean startup team, you’ll be given responsibilities and opportunities that would take a while to reach at any large organization.

Responsibilities

  • Create and develop new opportunities (add prospects to the pipeline)

  • Research the industry, identify target organizations

  • Spend a significant amount of time making calls, sending emails to prospects

  • Land meetings and pitch partnership opportunities via phone or in-person

  • Work with Sales Managers to convert leads into new business

  • Support Sales Managers with account management-bettering the chances for renewal on partnership or to create new revenue opportunities


Requirements
  • US Based
  • You understand Startup Grind: Who’s in our community, who we sell to, etc.
  • You are highly organized, with an acute attention to detail
  • You are a hustler - you get things done and are willing to put in the extra time when needed.
  • You’re a team player, but can also stay motivated working on your own  
  • You’re comfortable speaking to all types of people, building business relationships
  • You’re ideally located in the Bay Area, working with the team in San Francisco at least 3 days per week
  • BONUS if you come on board with leads of your own, from within your network or due to prior research

Perks
  • Benefits
  • Stock options
  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Work from home on Mondays and Fridays
  • Bonuses and perks throughout the year as part of sales team goals

If you think you fit the role, please submit your CV/resume to jobs@startupgrind.com

Apply for this position

jobs@startupgrind.com

items.content:
Office Manager // Idagio

Company: Idagio

Tags:
  • management
  • administration
  • music
  • Office

    • ABOUT US

    “This startup is set to revolutionize classical music” – Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung

    We are a technology company that is driven by the mission to build the world’s best streaming service for classical music lovers. We’re the only service worldwide that is able to offer the specialized search that lovers of this genre want and need. A search that they can’t and won’t get at Spotify, Apple Music or Youtube.

    We are honoured to also work directly with the world’s leading musicians and institutions, including the Vienna Philharmonic, the Philharmonia Orchestra and the Israel Philharmonic.

    IDAGIO is available to music lovers across the globe, but physically we are rooted in Berlin and consider the German-speaking countries our home base, as the world perceives them as the cradle and the center of classical music.

    WHERE YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE

    • Being responsible for the reception area, greeting visitors and for general email and phone enquiries
    • Ensuring that our team members and guests feel welcome at IDAGIO
    • Contributing to a supportive, passionate, and committed team culture
    • Maintaining correspondence with various vendors and keeping stock of office supplies
    • Supporting team members in administrative tasks such as travel bookings
    • Working closely with Finance and HR to maintain budgets, coordinate and plan team events, and onboard new team members
    • Handling requests and queries from our founders accordingly
    • Defining, developing, and implementing office procedures/policies in a fast-growing startup setting
    • Continuing to grow professionally through personal projects

    EXPERIENCE AND PERSONALITY TRAITS WE FIND RELEVANT FOR THIS POSITION

    • At least 2-3 years experience in Office Management or Administration in an international, professional environment, ideally in a startup
    • Fluency in German and English (spoken and written)
    • Impeccable time management skills and high attention to detail
    • Ability to multitask, prioritize various assignments, and solve problems dynamically
    • Knowledge of basic office tools like Excel, Google Suite, Slack etc.
    • Ability to work and make good judgments independently
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Open, friendly and positive personality
    • A passion for classical music is a big plus

    WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

    • Join an exceptional multinational team of 70 and shape the future of classical music
    • Enjoy a positive and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Kreuzberg
    • Contribute directly to the success of our game-changing product
    • Enjoy flexible working hours, occasional remote work and using the tools and hardware of your choice
    • IDAGIO is well funded by renowned investors such as Tengelmann Ventures, Macquarie Capital and b-to-v
    • A competitive salary and a yearly education budget
    • Sharpen your piano skills on our Steinway Model D, and yes, there is good coffee too
    • We can support you with your Visa process and can answer your questions around relocation. Berlin is a beautiful city with lots to offer.
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Account Executive (North America)

Company: Award Force
Headquarters: Australia
https://www.awardforce.com/
This role needs to be based, or able to work, in the following time zones: UTC-7, UTC-8, UTC-10

At Award Force, we work closely with our prospects to guide them through each step of the decision process and help prepare them to be long-term clients. Account Executives work with qualified opportunities providing online demos, product information, and ongoing communication through to welcoming new clients.  

We have solid sales traction with a much-loved product which has well-and-truly found market fit, and you’ll be helping to accelerate our growth.

As a respected member of our remote global sales team, you will be well supported with the tools, knowledge and answers you need to provide exceptional levels of service. 

Responsibilities

  • Close new business consistently at or above quota

  • Become an expert in SaaS for recognition programs

  • Uncover and build relationships at all levels

  • Proficient use of our sales technology stack  

  • Build and maintain pipeline momentum

  • Manage the sales process from qualified lead, online demos, proposals and close

  • Master and maintain knowledge of product, market and technology trends

  • Energetically embrace our global mission!

Essentials

The following requirements are absolute. If you cannot honestly say with certainty that you fulfil these essential expectations of the role, then this is not the job you are looking for.

  • Proven track record of high performance in an online sales environment

  • Able to work remotely and own your outcomes

  • Loads of energy, humour, passion, and empathy

  • A passion for technology

  • A powerful work ethic

  • Attention to detail

  • Voracious learner

  • Superior communication skills

  • Committed to continuous improvement

  • Fast, reliable internet access

Sound challenging? Fun? It is, and rewarding too— knowing you’re selling a great product and seeing your nurtured prospects turn into happy clients.

What we offer

  • Full-time role, based remotely 

  • A competitive salary commensurate with experience

  • Regular communication with the global team via chat and daily video calls

  • Opportunity to boost your career and income with a growing business

  • Training, support, and ongoing coaching  

  • Open, collaborative culture

Apply for this position

items.title: 51Blocks: Senior Sales Representative
items.content:
Senior Sales Representative

Company: 51Blocks
Headquarters: Remote (Denver, CO)
https://www.51blocks.com/contact/careers/
51Blocks is Denver's premier boutique Internet Marketing Agency. We provide SEO, PPC, Social Media, and other internet marketing tools and services for small businesses. We are looking for an excellent communicator that can grow new accounts from their home office and our inbound tools to effectively present and close small businesses to use our platform.

Is this you or what you like?

  • Autonomy - We welcome people who are looking to drive their own success.  Someone who enjoys working without a boss looking over your shoulder. Someone who likes to have their own time and space to do their best work.  Together we will set goals and define what success looks like together.

  • Purpose - At 51Blocks we are looking for someone who enjoys growing and developing business online - helping them understand their ROI and showing them how we grow their business.  We have people who love helping small business but at the same time are growing their passion in different areas. For example, we have Reggie who loves music and creates his own. Any time we run into anything in that field he loves working and helping those people.  What is your passion and how can we align that?

  • Always Learning - We welcome new ideas and always want you to be learning.  We hope that you would have a curiosity that pushes you to learn and grow consistently.

  • Who You Will Report To - You will work directly with the Founder and Owner of the company.  Your daily activities will have major impact on the company.

Are you ok with these expectations and responsibilities?

  • Expectations - We are looking for an excellent communicator that can grow new accounts by utilizing the phone, internet and our inbound tools to effectively present and close small businesses to use our platform. You will be expected to maintain a consistent pipeline, and hit all goals and quotas agreed upon by you and the owner. You prefer to work in a fast paced environment with lots of moving parts. You enjoy closing but are not bothered by rejection. You are organized, resourceful and persistent with your needs. Lastly, you are savvy with technology and will have no problem navigating multiple software tools and digital platforms to make your job easy

  • Drive revenue by acquiring new customers and make outbound calls to small and medium-sized businesses

  • Set and run online product demonstrations along with using sales strategies to close deals

If this position sounds like something you want to be a part of please apply.  We will reach back out in a few days if there is a good fix. We hope that whoever applies enjoys having fun and working hard every day.  

Compensation will be a base + commission.  

REQUIREMENTS FOR APPLICATION:

If you are interested please respond with a unique cover letter, your current resume, and a 90-day plan with goals of what you would hope to accomplish and a compensation plan you would like to see. You will be selling SEO, PPC, email marketing automation and other digital products so you should be familiar with the industry of digital marketing as a whole.  


Apply for this position

brittany@51blocks.com

What We're Building

Kwanzoo’s building a new B2B SaaS category that drives real sales and marketing alignment. Our customers run Account-based Marketing (ABM), B2B Retargeting and Personalized Display programs, all on one platform. As a result they:

- Manage all targeted display programs in one place
- Provide account-level engagement insights to sales teams directly in CRM

We are tackling these "Big Problems":

- Integrate within and across marketing tech

- Make B2B behavioral data easy to normalize, store, and use

Sales Executive at Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org

Dubai, Remote · Full Time
Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.Read More

Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.

How?

Our vision is to improve accessibility through modern technology.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help us create the next big thing. Help us shake up the scene using your strengths and bring new ideas to the table.

We are a dynamic young startup based out of Dubai, looking to grow the family. Be a part of this exciting phase and grow something that is growing fast.

About the team: We are result driven, value being practical, our work environment is flexible, and we are all very ambitious. Are you someone who wants to create something amazing, be empowered and are hands on?

Who we are? At Teach Me Now, we are an international mix that have passions for things like rollerblading, argentine tango, intellectual debates and indulging in amazing food at the office.

We are looking for people who dare to be different and want to be a part of something that help change the way the world learns.

Applied
Apply to Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org
Add a message to Teach Me Now And EdTechSolutions.org
Apply

Job Description

Are you amazing at sales and looking for a new opportunity with big incentives? Are you result oriented?

We are looking to hire a passionate sales executive with experience in either educational or technology sales.

You will be building relationships with key partners and selling an educational software solution that is growing globally and helping thousands of students have access to education on a daily basis.

We are looking for someone with an eye for sales, passion for education/tech and an international approach.

We are a growing dynamic and international team looking for the right people to make things happen. Do you have what it takes?

Functional Role:

- Sell educational products to schools, governments, institutes and HR departments.

- Implement marketing and promotion strategy to the identified key operators to promote Teach Me Now as a software-as-a-service solution to further advance the teaching and learning process of schools, institutions and governments;

- Continuously improve marketing and and sales strategies;

- Coordinate with set up of new customers;

Required Skills / Experience:

- You must be fluent in English

- Background in education and technology sales

- Result driven and a proven track record of targets

- Full of initiative

- Knowledge and experience of sales and marketing strategy

- Strategic Thinking and planning skills

- Presentation Skills/ Good at Public Speaking

- Communication & Relationship Management

Apply with your cv and cover letter to hr@teachmenow.com today.

Sales, Education

No Equity

What We're Building

We aim to make knowledge accessible through modern technology. To achieve our goal, we are doing two things.

Creating educational software and at the same time hosting a global marketplace for one to one learning - where anyone can teach and everyone can learn.

Teach Me Now is our public facing website and marketplace, where we have teachers/ tutors and students learning around the world. The goal is:

1. Make expert knowledge and education accessible through simple and modern technology

2. Create jobs for young people.

Through EdTechSolutions.org and in our second phase is licensing this software to schools and educational systems, to become more than just an LMS or storage provider. We help them become an online school and sell their expertise online.

Future phases have many exciting plans. Be a part of something exciting and new, and that will have an impact on generations to come.

items.title: SAAS Sales Manager
items.content:
SAAS Sales Manager

Anywhere in the US
Company: Follow Up Boss

FULL-TIME

Overview

Who Is Follow Up Boss?

  • We’re a SaaS solution that accelerates sales for real estate teams
  • We’re a self funded, profitable company founded in 2011
  • We’re a remote company with a mostly US-based team
  • We don’t just claim to be customer-centric – we live it: https://www.facebook.com/followupboss/reviews
  • Check out our video on how we work: https://www.followupboss.com/about/
Why Would You Want To Work Here?

  • We’re a young, ambitious company who only answers to our customers
  • Opportunity to have a big impact on our growth and your career
  • No red tape or pointless meetings
  • Competitive base salary + performance bonus, health/dental insurance, company meet-ups and 20 days paid holiday each year
  • See a direct impact of your work and value you create for our business and customers.
This Role Is For You If…

  • You want to sell a best in class SaaS product
  • You’re independent, self-motivated and get results
  • You’ve got the experience + skills and want to work remotely without the commute
Your qualifications:

  • A successful track record in SaaS sales management with a focus on inside sales and SMB (3+ years)
  • Passion for delivering value to the customer, maximizing their success.
  • Proven experience finding and hiring top sales performers
  • Experience and processes for coaching team members and helping them improve their performance
  • Excellent questioning, qualification and closing skills.
  • Superb written and verbal skills (with a professional yet fun demeanor)
  • Self motivated and proactive mindset.
  • Based in the USA, quiet home office with fast internet.
Your responsibilities will include:

  • Leading by example and work with leads/customers directly as you build out the team
  • Hire, train, motivate and hold accountable all sales positions and support them in achieving and exceeding their targets.
  • Coach and mentor the team to improve sales processes and service our customers receive.
  • Ensure we’re prioritizing high value leads and bringing on best fit customers
  • Provide management and focus to drive results, set expectations, and manage performance.
  • Monitor sales activity and evaluate against goals to measure growth, opportunity and productivity.
  • Accurately report sales results to team and company
If this sounds like a great fit we would love to hear from you, drop us a line.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Business Development Executive (Exovera)

Company: SOSi
Headquarters: Reston, VA

Company Overview

For 29 years, clients in the private and public sectors have relied upon SOS International LLC (SOSi) for critical operations in the world’s most challenging environments. SOSi is privately held, was founded by its current ownership in 1989, maintains corporate headquarters in New York City, and specializes in providing logistics, construction, training, intelligence, and information technology solutions to the defense, diplomatic, intelligence and law enforcement communities.

All interested individuals will receive consideration and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or protected veteran status. SOSi takes affirmative action in support of its policy to advance diversity and inclusion of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.


EXOVERA-180808-7423: Business Development Executive (Exovera)

Location
U.S. - Virginia - Reston

Open Date
8/8/2018



JOB DESCRIPTION

Exovera LLC (www.exovera.com) a wholly-owned subsidiary of SOSi, is seeking to hire a Business Development Executive reporting directly to the CEO.This position, based in Reston, VA, is an incredible opportunity to work with big data and artificial intelligence systems that were developed to meet government and military IO objectives and recently customized for the commercial sector.
The successful candidate must demonstrate strong entrepreneurial skills and have a proven track record selling application software and data solutions to global Fortune 2000 companies, trade associations, election groups, lobbying organizations and public relations firms.
Responsibilities:
  • Plan – develop global business plan, target territory and account plans, and annual/quarterly forecasts tied to company revenue objectives.
  • Sell – identify, contact, promote, qualify, and close new sales for Exovera’s products.
  • Lead – Build and manage an international sales team and distribution network capable of marketing and selling the Exovera product line.
  • Manage – maintain strong business relationships with all new/existing clients to optimize customer satisfaction and repeat sales opportunities. Utilize on-line CRM to maintain up-to-date customer profiles, sales opportunities and forecasts.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Media, Communications or related field
  • 7+ years sales experience with proven track record of successful growth
  • Experience selling complex software solutions priced between 100K-$1M on a recurring basis
  • Verifiable history of accountability, perseverance and over-quota achievement
  • Professional attributes required to lead complex sales initiatives
  • Strong existing business relationships with customers in target industries
  • Strong entrepreneurial spirit that makes you comfortable being challenged and taking on calculated business risks
  • Command of a value-centric sales approach that allows you to establish highly profitable customer relationships that renew year after year
  • Strong task-orientation with problem-solving skills that allow you to operate as an autonomous member of the team
  • Disciplined sales data collection, reporting and analytics via CRM, MS Office as well as experience with social media
  • Excellent verbal, writing, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong research, analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Public relations experience a plus
  • International sales experience a plus
  • Government/military contracting business development experience a plus
  • Ability to travel 25% of the time.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

About Exovera:
Exovera LLC (www.exovera.com), a wholly-owned subsidiary of defense contractor SOSi, has been providing media services and technology solutions for government and military operations around the world since 2006. Exovera NarrativesTM is a unique platform that harnesses the value of big (media) data across hundreds of thousands traditional and social media sources to analyze campaign engagement at scale. We enable communications professionals and influencers to a) understand what their audiences are thinking based on their media consumption, b) refine their messaging and c) measure their campaign ROI.

items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Web Strategists advance account growth and acquisition (sales) by applying a sophisticated understanding of 10up's capabilities to client and prospect business goals, buttressed by superior communication, attention to detail, and ownership of company sales goals.

Responsibilities

  • Communicate with prospective clients via calls, video conferencing, and in-person sessions to understand goals and define strategic and tactical plans aligned to their needs and 10up strengths.
  • Write, edit, revise, and complete compelling emails, proposals, and other documents to drive prospective and current clients buy in to 10up's strategies and approaches.
  • Negotiate client goals, constraints, and 10up resourcing and delivery standards to create detailed contracts, proposals, and project plans that set 10up and its clients up for success.
  • Support and grow client relationships via regular check-ins and collaboration with client and production teams; complete all related deliverables necessary to ensure outstanding client service in a timely and insightful manner.
  • Maintain accurate, timely, and detailed documentation for deals, client relationships, and projects.
  • Successfully manage and grow relationships with partners in hosting, technology, and related areas.

 

Requirements

  • Experience with and passion for building websites (or other platforms using web technologies).
  • Experience with and knowledge of web content management systems (CMS), preferably WordPress or similar open source platforms.
  • Experience producing client agreements and proposals.
  • Knowledge of common metrics for digital media success and popular tools and mechanisms for measuring success (e.g. Google Analytics).
  • Outstanding written communication.
  • Outstanding verbal communication.
  • Outstanding collaboration skills, inspiring consensus and collaboration from varied internal and external stakeholders.
  • Passion for helping clients and prospects move from concept to execution by matching their goals to 10up expertise.
  • Comfortable networking and building new relationships on behalf of 10up.
  • Willingness to take initiative and help with a variety of account service tasks.

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with core 10up disciplines, e.g. back and front end engineering, UX and visual design, ad strategy, and audience growth.
  • A strong familiarity with the WordPress and web development ecosystem, e.g. knowledge of popular tools, plugins, frameworks, best practices, and conventions.
  • Hands on experience building websites using PHP and WordPress.
  • Experience with the digital marketing ecosystem of tools, e.g. Google Analytics, DFP.
  • Experience with MS Office, Google Docs, Apple Pages, Apple Keynote, and Teamwork.
  • Remote working experience appreciated.

items.content:
Sales Manager

Company: Ergeon Inc.

A Bit about Us

Ergeon aims to become the #1 trusted provider of tech-enabled Fence Installation Service. We provide an amazingly better experience using software and data that enable our service personnel to be more effective and efficient. We are pioneering the tech-enabled home services space with a full-stack approach.

Overview of the Role

This is a fully remote position. We are looking for an experienced Sales Manager to lead the remotely-based and onsite Sales Team. The Sales Manager is responsible for driving sales through the coaching and development of Inside Sales Representatives, Outside Estimators, and Quoters. The Sales Manager will train and mentor sales staff to ensure best practices are implemented to achieve success in reaching company objectives.


Responsibilities

Responsible for leading Sales Team

Monitor, track and report team performance based on Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s)

Identify skill gaps and provide personal ongoing support and feedback

Support leadership’s vision to build and develop an effective and high performing team

Assist representatives with difficult or escalated calls by possessing a high level of product knowledge and process expertise

Supervise the workflow of team members

Ability to deliver in high pressure growth environments

Desired Skills and Experience

Must have:

3-5 years experience in supervising a successful sales team

Available 8am - 5pm PST Full-Time

Proven leader in a sales environment

In-depth knowledge and experience in sales, negotiation and closing techniques

Experience conceptualizing and developing scalable sales processes

Excellent oral and written communication skills

Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to function in a fast paced environment

Nice to have:
BA/BS degree or equivalent relevant experience in Business Administration, Management, Marketing, or related field

Experience in construction or home improvement industry

Experience managing remote teams

Benefits

Competitive Salary

Paid Days Off

$200 reimbursed annually for software/hardware or home office improvements

Amazing remote company culture!

Apply directly by using the job site link.

Sales at Universally Thinking

Cincinnati, Remote · Cofounder
If your dream job consists of being encouraged to think abstractly, to question what is possible and to push the limits of the unfortunate, current state of our creative reality... we may be a perfect fit.Read More

If your dream job consists of being encouraged to think abstractly, to question what is possible and to push the limits of the unfortunate, current state of our creative reality... we may be a perfect fit.

There will always be a need for innovation and creativity. The current state of our creative reality rests at just a fraction of its potential greatness. We are here to help society realize its ingenuitive potential.

Collectively we've spent Billions of dollars on "The Next Big Thing" which was just a micro-sized version of a technology that has existed for over 10 years. Yes I am talking about the Smart-Watch. No I do not own one.

It is sad to say, but top Tech Corporations need help innovating. "Innovation" as it stands for Tech Corps is to wait for a startup to grow large enough for it to be a justifiable acquisition.

Instead of this model of what I like to call "Observe and Acquire" why not move on to "Risk and Realize." In other words, why not do what Microsoft (yes I said Microsoft) has done and take a chance on new technology (HoloLens). Of course I could have said (and should have said) Google for it's Glass project as well. Google's Glass 1.0 flopped but they still tried. And yes, I would have purchased one.

How can Universally Thinking help? Simple. We can think like a consumer and think like a startup. I am not going to say that all of our concepts will be huge but, I do believe that any company that currently aims to produce a facade of being a "top innovator" can achieve the more desirable reality of being a top innovator with us on their side.

Consumers can only purchase the same technology for so long before they start going outside and socializing again (look up dopamine). @AllInclusiveTagForTechCompanies Why not start taking chances? Sure they could flop.. but learn from Microsoft and Google.. Even the failed concepts will strengthen your reputation as innovators. The lame duck stops here, just another Universal Thought.
